column5: Hey Gang! I was approached by a fella doing a article on Urban Fisheries and l'm trying to locate some of the posts I did on fishing the GTA from the Old Board. Rick, Roy... is this still possible? I remember someone posting some kind of search for the Pro-Board. Is this option still avalible? Also when I do a search on myself here on this board it only goes so far back. Is there a way to find some of these older posts?   FHR
Try using Google Ric... lots of stuff comes up from days past.
Terry...you just beat me to it!  I was going thru Gerritt's old posts...I remembered he posted that link a while ago.
Just went to those links...they used to work...now they just go to the ontariofishing.net splash page...the messageboard posts are not there anymore....
you follow the links though the message board and many do work
Ahh ok...tried that with 3...and didn't work...just my luck!  I'll go back now...Thanks Terry.
That's exactly what l was looking for! Thanks Terry!  Ric

This was vintage Canadave.  He adds every day to this board by his historic contributions, deeply woven in the weft and the whoopf, the wharp and the wooft, the harp and the wept.  Deeply woven, in the weave, and all that.

Weave this into your weft....  Bonefish Guest   Wednesday, July 17, 2002 15:00:50 Subject: Peelers - Sudbury IP: Logged  Message: Heading in a couple of weeks to Chapleau fishing and the boys thought we would stop on our way up on the Friday for a little peel action on route. Assuming there would be squat in Chapleau, we wuz wondering if anyone has any insight on the Peeler action in Sudbury.   BigJoe Guest   Wednesday, July 17, 2002 16:40:18 RE: Peelers - Sudbury IP: Logged  Message: solid gold off falconbridge road& the colson downtoun some where. Good Luck Bro.   Rusty Lure Guest   Wednesday, July 17, 2002 19:48:17 RE: Peelers - Sudbury IP: Logged  Message: Big Joe nailed it...Solid Gold is the place to go.   Bonefish Guest   Thursday, July 18, 2002 09:34:09 RE: Peelers - Sudbury IP: Logged  Message: Thanks for the "Solid" advice. Appreciated
I'm getting a little teary eyed, and, well, somewhat verklempt.  That was beautiful.  *sniff*
I'll have what he's drinkin' bartender!
